channel.title: CNN.com
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: England snags cricket's Ashes trophy
item.description: For the first time in 24 years, England beat Australia on Aussie home turf in a series of matches for cricket's historic Ashes trophy.

item.title: Britain, Canada reject Gbagbo's authority
item.description: The British government has announced it has recognized Alassane Ouattara as the democratically elected president of Ivory Coast.

item.title: Israeli forces hit Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces carried out air strikes late Thursday in Gaza, but there were no reports of casualties, Israeli officials and a Hamas official concurred Friday.

item.title: Sources: Terror alert raised for London
item.description: New information has emerged from an intelligence operation about the possibility of an attack being planned in or near London, with subway stations and airports of particular concern to officials, a British security source told CNN Thursday.

item.title: New Year mass rape in Congo reported
item.description: Dozens of women were raped in a coordinated attack in the Democratic Republic of Congo on New Year's Day, Doctors Without Borders said Thursday.

item.title: Crops, industry hit by Australian floods
item.description: Major flooding across eastern Australia is putting a squeeze on the region's farmers, destroying crops and cutting off routes to market.

item.title: Doctor defends autism-vaccine study
item.description: A physician accused of "elaborate fraud" in a now-retracted British study that linked autism to childhood vaccines tells CNN his work has been "grossly distorted."

item.title: Obama names new chief of staff
item.description: Former Commerce Secretary William Daley will be President Barack Obama's new White House chief of staff, two senior officials said Thursday.

item.title: U.S. military cuts billions in budget
item.description: Defense Secretary Robert Gates staged a pre-emptive attack Thursday in Washington's looming budget battles, announcing cuts of $78 billion to the U.S. military and defense department, including reducing the size of the Army and Marine Corps.

item.title: Suspected assassin in Pakistan court
item.description: The security guard accused of assassinating the governor of Pakistan's Punjab province was ordered into police custody for five days Thursday, after a court hearing on his case had to be moved several times.
